cautions: Holistic management approach; avoid over-reliance on opioids
medications: Analgesics, certain antidepressants and anticonvulsants may help symptom control
prevention: Regular exercise, sleep hygiene, stress management
treatment: Multimodal care with exercise, cognitive-behavioral approaches, and pharmacologic symptom control

overview: Persistent non-cyclical pelvic pain affecting quality of life with multifactorial causes.
symptoms: chronic pelvic pain; urinary symptoms; sexual dysfunction; emotional impact
cautions: Comprehensive assessment to exclude treatable causes; multidisciplinary care
medications: Symptom-targeted therapies including pain modulators, pelvic physiotherapy
prevention: Pelvic floor exercises; stress management; early treatment of urological/gynaecological causes
treatment: Treat underlying causes when identified; multidisciplinary pain management and physiotherapy

overview: Chronic bladder/pelvic pain disorder with urinary urgency and frequency often without clear infection.
symptoms: bladder pain; urinary frequency/urgency; dyspareunia
cautions: Rule out infection and other causes before labeling; multidisciplinary care
medications: Bladder instillations, oral medications (amitriptyline), pain management and physiotherapy
prevention: Avoid bladder irritants (caffeine, spicy foods); bladder training
treatment: Lifestyle modification, bladder-directed therapies, pelvic floor rehabilitation; specialized care for refractory cases

overview: Frequent disabling headaches occurring on ≥15 days per month with migrainous features on many days.
symptoms: frequent headaches; medication overuse can worsen condition; nausea and sensitivity to light/sound
cautions: Avoid medication overuse; specialist headache clinic referral for refractory cases
medications: Preventive therapies (beta blockers, anticonvulsants), CGRP inhibitors for eligible patients
prevention: Identify and avoid triggers; sleep and stress management
treatment: Preventive pharmacotherapy, botulinum toxin injections for some patients, neuromodulation and multidisciplinary care

overview: Jaw joint dysfunction causing facial pain, limited mouth opening, and clicking or locking of the jaw.
symptoms: jaw pain; difficulty chewing; clicking/popping of joint; headaches
cautions: Avoid overuse of jaw; dental referral when structural problems suspected
medications: Analgesics, mouth guards for bruxism, physiotherapy; dental interventions if indicated
prevention: Avoid hard foods; manage stress and bruxism; dental hygiene
treatment: Conservative care with physiotherapy, occlusal splints, dental/orthodontic corrective measures for structural issues

overview: Chronic inflammatory gum disease leading to tooth-supporting structure loss and potential systemic links to cardiovascular disease.
symptoms: bleeding gums; receding gums; tooth mobility; bad breath
cautions: Urgent dental review for loose teeth; maintain oral hygiene to prevent progression
medications: Professional dental cleaning (scaling), topical or systemic antibiotics in specific cases
prevention: Regular dental check-ups; daily flossing and brushing; smoking cessation
treatment: Periodontal therapy including scaling/root planing, possible surgery, ongoing maintenance and hygiene

overview: Progressive demineralization of tooth enamel caused by bacterial acids resulting in cavities and pain if advanced.
symptoms: tooth sensitivity; localized pain; visible pits or holes in teeth
cautions: Early dental care prevents progression; treat promptly to avoid abscess
medications: Restorative dental treatment (fillings); fluoride therapy; endodontic treatment for deep decay
prevention: Fluoride toothpaste; reduce sugar intake; regular dental visits
treatment: Restoration of carious lesions, root canal therapy for pulp involvement, extraction when tooth non-restorable

overview: Infection of bone and bone marrow often secondary to trauma, surgery, or spread from adjacent tissue.
symptoms: localized bone pain; fever; swelling; reduced function of affected limb
cautions: Prompt diagnosis and treatment to prevent chronic disease and sequestra formation
medications: Prolonged targeted antibiotics; surgical debridement when needed
prevention: Prompt care of wounds and skin infections; sterile technique in procedures
treatment: Long-course antibiotics guided by cultures, surgical debridement for necrotic bone, orthopedic follow-up

overview: Infection within a joint causing severe pain and rapid joint destruction if not treated promptly.
symptoms: acute severe joint pain; swelling; erythema; fever; inability to move joint
cautions: Emergency orthopedic and infectious disease evaluation required
medications: Joint drainage and targeted IV antibiotics
prevention: Prompt treatment of bacteremia and infections; joint protection
treatment: Urgent joint aspiration/drainage and IV antibiotics; pain control and rehabilitation

overview: Cardiac valve damage following untreated or severe group A streptococcal infection in childhood.
symptoms: valvular murmurs; heart failure signs in advanced disease; palpitations
cautions: Preventable with early treatment of strep throat; long-term cardiology follow-up for affected individuals
medications: Long-term secondary prophylaxis with penicillin where indicated; manage heart failure medically
prevention: Prompt diagnosis and treatment of streptococcal infections; vaccination research ongoing
treatment: Medical management of heart failure symptoms; valve repair or replacement when indicated; secondary prophylaxis programs

overview: Rapid loss of liver function with coagulopathy and encephalopathy; multiple causes including drug-induced and viral.
symptoms: jaundice; confusion; bleeding; low urine output; abdominal pain
cautions: Medical emergency—urgent referral to transplant center when criteria met
medications: Supportive ICU care; treat specific causes (antidotes like N-acetylcysteine for paracetamol toxicity)
prevention: Avoid hepatotoxins; vaccination where applicable (hepatitis A/B)
treatment: Intensive supportive care; treat underlying cause; liver transplant evaluation for irreversible failure

overview: Progressive scarring of the liver with portal hypertension and multi-system complications.
symptoms: fatigue; jaundice; ascites; easy bruising; encephalopathy in advanced stages
cautions: Vaccinate against hepatitis where appropriate; avoid alcohol in liver disease
medications: Treat complications (diuretics for ascites, lactulose for encephalopathy); manage underlying causes
prevention: Limit alcohol; treat viral hepatitis; weight management for NAFLD
treatment: Manage portal hypertension and complications, treat underlying cause, transplant evaluation for end-stage disease

overview: Fat accumulation in the liver related to metabolic syndrome which can progress to steatohepatitis and cirrhosis.
symptoms: often asymptomatic; fatigue; elevated liver enzymes on blood tests
cautions: Address metabolic risk factors early to prevent progression
medications: Lifestyle measures to reduce weight; manage diabetes and dyslipidemia; specialist care for NASH
prevention: Weight loss; exercise; control of diabetes and lipids
treatment: Lifestyle modification is cornerstone; treat metabolic comorbidities and consider specialist trials for NASH

overview: Sudden pancreatic inflammation with potential for multi-organ failure and necrosis in severe cases.
symptoms: severe epigastric pain radiating to back; vomiting; systemic inflammatory response
cautions: Admit for monitoring and early aggressive supportive care; consider ICU for organ dysfunction
medications: Aggressive IV fluids, analgesia, organ support; treat underlying cause
prevention: Avoid heavy alcohol use; manage gallstones proactively
treatment: Hospitalization with fluid resuscitation, pain control, nutritional support, interventions for complications such as necrosis or infected collections

overview: Liver injury spectrum from steatosis to alcoholic hepatitis and cirrhosis due to chronic alcohol use.
symptoms: fatigue; jaundice; hepatomegaly; ascites; risk of bleeding
cautions: Early alcohol cessation improves outcomes; specialist addiction support recommended
medications: Supportive care and management of complications; consider corticosteroids for severe alcoholic hepatitis in selected cases
prevention: Avoid alcohol; seek addiction services early
treatment: Alcohol cessation and supportive management; treat complications; transplant considered in selected patients after abstinence and evaluation

overview: Symptom complex after abrupt cessation or reduction of heavy/prolonged alcohol use, can be life-threatening.
symptoms: tremor; agitation; sweating; hallucinations; seizures in severe cases
cautions: Hospitalize for severe withdrawal or seizure risk; benzodiazepines under supervision are usually required
medications: Benzodiazepines for symptomatic control in supervised setting; supportive care and thiamine supplementation
prevention: Avoid abrupt cessation without medical advice for heavy drinkers; seek supervised detoxification
treatment: Medical supervision with benzodiazepines, fluids, nutrition, thiamine; treat complications such as delirium tremens in ICU

overview: Chronic relapsing condition characterized by compulsive opioid use despite harm, with risk of overdose.
symptoms: cravings; loss of control over use; withdrawal symptoms; social/occupational impairment
cautions: Provide harm reduction (naloxone) and evidence-based treatment; avoid punitive approaches
medications: Medication-assisted treatment (methadone, buprenorphine) plus psychosocial therapies
prevention: Harm reduction services; supervised treatment programs; naloxone distribution
treatment: Medication-assisted treatment combined with counseling and social support; overdose prevention measures

overview: Toxic exposure to chemicals, pharmaceuticals, or toxins requiring rapid assessment and targeted management.
symptoms: variable depending on toxin: CNS depression, seizures, vomiting, metabolic disturbances
cautions: Immediate emergency care; supportive measures and specific antidotes when available
medications: Supportive care; specific antidotes where indicated (e.g., naloxone for opioid overdose)
prevention: Safe storage of chemicals and medications; poison control resources
treatment: Emergency decontamination and supportive care; antidotes if available; critical care for severe cases

overview: Persistent or new symptoms following acute SARS-CoV-2 infection affecting multiple organ systems.
symptoms: persistent fatigue; cognitive impairment ('brain fog'); dyspnea; chest pain; palpitations
cautions: Comprehensive multidisciplinary assessment recommended for prolonged symptoms
medications: Symptomatic management; tailored rehabilitation and specialist referrals
prevention: Vaccination reduces severe disease and may reduce long COVID risk; pacing and rehabilitation strategies
treatment: Multidisciplinary rehabilitation, symptom-targeted therapies, investigation for organ-specific sequelae and supportive care

overview: Infection at surgical incision site presenting days after surgery; can progress to deeper infection if untreated.
symptoms: localized pain; redness; swelling; purulent discharge; fever in systemic spread
cautions: Early recognition important to prevent dehiscence and systemic infection
medications: Antibiotics guided by culture; local wound care and drainage if needed
prevention: Aseptic technique in surgery; wound hygiene postoperatively
treatment: Wound assessment, drainage of abscesses, targeted antibiotics, surgical debridement for severe cases

overview: Localized injury to skin/underlying tissue from prolonged pressure, often in immobile patients.
symptoms: skin breakdown over bony prominences; pain; purulent discharge if infected
cautions: Regular repositioning and pressure care essential to prevent progression
medications: Debridement, topical care, antibiotics if infected
prevention: Regular repositioning, specialized mattresses, skin care
treatment: Pressure relief, wound care, debridement, nutritional support, and treatment of infection when present

overview: Chronic pain condition usually following injury or surgery with autonomic and trophic changes in the limb.
symptoms: severe burning pain; swelling; colour and temperature changes; diminished function
cautions: Early referral to pain specialist increases chance of better outcomes
medications: Multimodal pain management (analgesics, neuropathic agents), physiotherapy
prevention: Early mobilization after injury; pain management strategies
treatment: Multidisciplinary pain management including physiotherapy, medications, interventional procedures for refractory cases

overview: Psychiatric disorder following exposure to traumatic events leading to persistent intrusive symptoms and avoidance.
symptoms: flashbacks; nightmares; hypervigilance; avoidance; functional impairment
cautions: Early trauma-informed care; risk of self-harm in severe cases
medications: Trauma-focused psychotherapy (CBT, EMDR) and medications in selected patients
prevention: Safety planning and social support after traumatic events; early psychological support
treatment: Evidence-based psychotherapies are first-line; pharmacotherapy when indicated and crisis support if safety concerns arise

overview: Thermal, chemical, or electrical injury causing skin and underlying tissue damage with infection and fluid-loss risks.
symptoms: pain; blistering; charred skin; shock in extensive burns
cautions: Major burns need fluid resuscitation and specialist burns-unit care
medications: Analgesia, topical antimicrobials, tetanus prophylaxis when indicated
prevention: Fire safety, workplace precautions, proper handling of hot liquids
treatment: Initial cooling and resuscitation, wound care, burn unit care for major burns, surgical grafting when needed

overview: Acquired brain injury from external force causing cognitive, motor, and autonomic sequelae.
symptoms: loss of consciousness; headache; memory problems; focal neurological deficits
cautions: Urgent neuroimaging and neurosurgical assessment for severe injury; monitor for raised intracranial pressure
medications: Supportive critical care including intracranial pressure control and surgical intervention when needed
prevention: Use helmets and seatbelts; workplace safety measures
treatment: Acute neurosurgical and critical care management, rehabilitation for long-term deficits, multidisciplinary support

overview: Traumatic damage to spinal cord resulting in motor, sensory, and autonomic dysfunction below the lesion level.
symptoms: paralysis; loss of sensation; bowel/bladder dysfunction; autonomic instability in high lesions
cautions: Spinal immobilization at scene, urgent neurosurgical/orthopedic evaluation
medications: High-dose rehabilitation-focused care; manage complications like neurogenic bladder and pressure ulcers
prevention: Safe work and transport practices; fall prevention
treatment: Acute stabilization, surgical decompression if indicated, intensive rehabilitation and long-term multidisciplinary care

overview: Break in bone continuity; open fractures carry infection risk and need urgent care.
symptoms: localized pain; deformity; swelling; inability to bear weight
cautions: Open fractures are emergency—cover wound and urgent orthopedic care
medications: Immobilization, analgesia, antibiotics for open fractures, surgical fixation as required
prevention: Use protective equipment for risk activities; fall prevention in elderly
treatment: Reduction and immobilization, surgical fixation for displaced fractures, antibiotic therapy for open fractures, physiotherapy for recovery

overview: Raised pressure in a closed muscle compartment causing ischemia and potential permanent damage if untreated.
symptoms: severe pain out of proportion to injury, tense swollen compartment, pain on passive stretch
cautions: Emergency diagnosis—fasciotomy required to prevent permanent loss of limb function
medications: Emergency surgical fasciotomy is definitive
prevention: Protective measures to reduce crush injuries; early fracture care
treatment: Urgent fasciotomy to relieve pressure, supportive care, rehabilitation

overview: Inflammation of the tonsils due to viral or bacterial infection; common in children.
symptoms: sore throat; fever; difficulty swallowing; swollen lymph nodes
cautions: Seek care if severe pain or breathing issues
medications: Analgesics; antibiotics (if bacterial)
prevention: Hand hygiene; avoid sharing utensils
treatment: Rest; hydration; antibiotics if indicated

overview: Inflammation of the appendix requiring urgent care.
symptoms: Right lower abdominal pain; nausea; vomiting; fever
cautions: Emergency if pain worsens or with rebound tenderness
medications: IV fluids; antibiotics
prevention: No proven prevention
treatment: Surgical removal (appendectomy)

overview: Skin infestation by mites causing intense itching.
symptoms: Itchy rash; burrows; worse at night
cautions: Treat all close contacts simultaneously
medications: Permethrin cream; ivermectin (oral)
prevention: Wash bedding and clothes; avoid skin contact
treatment: Topical or oral antiparasitic agents

overview: Recurrent moderate-to-severe headaches often with nausea or light sensitivity.
symptoms: Throbbing head pain; visual aura; nausea; photophobia
cautions: Rule out secondary causes if new or severe
medications: Triptans; NSAIDs; prophylactic beta-blockers
prevention: Avoid triggers (stress, sleep loss, certain foods)
treatment: Pain relief and preventive medications

overview: Chronic autoimmune skin disorder causing scaly patches.
symptoms: Red scaly plaques; itching; joint pain (psoriatic arthritis)
cautions: Avoid skin trauma; monitor for arthritis
medications: Topical corticosteroids; biologics; vitamin D analogs
prevention: Stress management; skin hydration
treatment: Topical/systemic therapy based on severity

overview: Chronic inflammatory skin disease with itching and dryness.
symptoms: Itchy rash; dry skin; redness
cautions: Avoid scratching; risk of infection
medications: Moisturizers; corticosteroids; antihistamines
prevention: Gentle skincare; avoid triggers
treatment: Hydration; topical anti-inflammatory therapy

overview: Infection or inflammation of sinus cavities.
symptoms: Facial pain; nasal congestion; headache; fever
cautions: Persistent symptoms >10 days may indicate bacterial cause
medications: Decongestants; antibiotics (if bacterial)
prevention: Manage allergies; avoid smoke
treatment: Steam inhalation; nasal saline; antibiotics if bacterial

overview: Eye inflammation due to infection or allergy.
symptoms: Red eyes; discharge; itching; tearing
cautions: Highly contagious; maintain hygiene
medications: Antibiotic or antihistamine drops
prevention: Hand hygiene; avoid sharing eye products
treatment: Eye drops; avoid touching eyes

overview: Bacterial infection of urinary system.
symptoms: Burning urination; urgency; lower abdominal pain
cautions: If fever/back pain → may indicate kidney infection
medications: Nitrofurantoin; trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole
prevention: Hydration; proper hygiene; urinate after sex
treatment: Antibiotics and fluids

overview: Swollen veins in rectum/anus causing pain and bleeding.
symptoms: Bleeding after defecation; anal pain; swelling
cautions: Avoid straining; rule out rectal cancer if persistent
medications: Topical ointments; stool softeners
prevention: High-fiber diet; hydration
treatment: Sitz baths; topical relief; surgery if severe

overview: Open sores in stomach or duodenal lining often due to H. pylori or NSAIDs.
symptoms: Abdominal pain; bloating; nausea; heartburn
cautions: Avoid alcohol, smoking, and NSAID overuse
medications: Proton pump inhibitors; antibiotics for H. pylori
prevention: Limit NSAIDs; avoid smoking
treatment: Antibiotic eradication therapy; acid suppression

overview: Arthritis due to uric acid crystal buildup.
symptoms: Joint pain (often big toe); redness; swelling
cautions: Avoid alcohol and purine-rich foods
medications: NSAIDs; colchicine; allopurinol
prevention: Healthy diet; weight control
treatment: Pain relief and urate-lowering therapy

overview: Inflammation of bronchial tubes usually following a viral infection.
symptoms: Cough; mucus production; fatigue; chest discomfort
cautions: See doctor if cough persists >3 weeks
medications: Cough suppressants; bronchodilators
prevention: Avoid smoking; flu vaccination
treatment: Rest; fluids; symptomatic relief

overview: Enlarged, twisted veins due to valve failure in legs.
symptoms: Visible veins; leg pain; heaviness
cautions: Avoid prolonged standing
medications: Compression stockings; vein ablation
prevention: Regular exercise; weight management
treatment: Compression therapy or surgical options

overview: Crystallized bile deposits forming in gallbladder.
symptoms: Abdominal pain after fatty meals; nausea; vomiting
cautions: Seek care if severe pain or jaundice
medications: Pain relief; surgery if recurrent
prevention: Healthy diet; weight management
treatment: Laparoscopic cholecystectomy if symptomatic

overview: Inflammation of the pancreas, often alcohol or gallstone-related.
symptoms: Severe upper abdominal pain; vomiting; fever
cautions: Can be life-threatening; hospital care needed
medications: IV fluids; pain relief
prevention: Avoid alcohol; manage triglycerides
treatment: Hospital management; supportive care

overview: Nasal inflammation triggered by allergens.
symptoms: Sneezing; runny nose; itchy eyes
cautions: Avoid known allergens
medications: Antihistamines; nasal corticosteroids
prevention: Avoid triggers; air filtration
treatment: Allergen avoidance and medication

overview: Allergic skin reaction with itchy raised welts.
symptoms: Red, raised, itchy bumps on skin
cautions: Seek care if associated with breathing difficulty
medications: Antihistamines; corticosteroids
prevention: Avoid allergens and stress
treatment: Symptomatic relief and trigger management

overview: Low hemoglobin due to iron loss or poor intake.
symptoms: Fatigue; pallor; shortness of breath
cautions: Check for underlying bleeding source
medications: Iron supplements; dietary iron
prevention: Iron-rich foods; treat underlying cause
treatment: Iron replacement therapy

overview: Loss of skin pigment due to autoimmune destruction of melanocytes.
symptoms: Pale white patches on skin
cautions: No danger but psychological stress common
medications: Topical corticosteroids; phototherapy
prevention: Sun protection; counseling
treatment: Skin camouflage and repigmentation therapy

overview: Rare malignancy of gallbladder lining.
symptoms: Right upper abdominal pain; jaundice; weight loss
cautions: Poor prognosis; early detection important
medications: Chemotherapy; surgery
prevention: Healthy diet; avoid gallstones
treatment: Surgical removal if resectable

overview: Degeneration of neck vertebrae causing pain and stiffness.
symptoms: Neck pain; numbness in arms; headaches
cautions: Avoid sudden jerks or poor posture
medications: Pain relievers; physiotherapy
prevention: Regular exercise; posture correction
treatment: Physical therapy; surgery if nerve compression

overview: Chronic neurological disorder with recurrent seizures.
symptoms: Seizures; confusion; loss of consciousness
cautions: Avoid driving until controlled
medications: Antiepileptics (valproate, carbamazepine)
prevention: Medication adherence; sleep hygiene
treatment: Long-term medication management

overview: Urge to move legs at rest, disrupting sleep.
symptoms: Leg discomfort; insomnia
cautions: Avoid caffeine and alcohol
medications: Dopamine agonists; iron supplements
prevention: Sleep hygiene; exercise
treatment: Medication for symptom control

overview: Increased intraocular pressure damaging optic nerve.
symptoms: Vision loss; eye pain; halos around lights
cautions: Regular eye exams essential
medications: Eye drops (latanoprost, timolol)
prevention: Routine screening
treatment: Laser or surgical pressure reduction

overview: Clouding of the eye’s lens, causing blurred vision.
symptoms: Blurry vision; glare; color fading
cautions: Surgery needed if vision severely affected
medications: None specific
prevention: UV protection; control diabetes
treatment: Lens replacement surgery

overview: Infection of middle ear common in children.
symptoms: Ear pain; fever; hearing difficulty
cautions: Seek care if recurrent
medications: Antibiotics; analgesics
prevention: Vaccination; hygiene
treatment: Medication or tympanostomy if recurrent

overview: Lumps in thyroid gland; mostly benign.
symptoms: Neck swelling; hoarseness
cautions: Assess malignancy via biopsy
medications: Thyroid hormone therapy if indicated
prevention: Iodine sufficiency
treatment: Observation or surgery if cancerous

overview: Excess thyroid hormone production.
symptoms: Weight loss; tremor; palpitations
cautions: Monitor heart rate and bone health
medications: Methimazole; beta-blockers
prevention: Regular follow-up
treatment: Antithyroid drugs or radioactive iodine

overview: Underactive thyroid gland causing slow metabolism.
symptoms: Fatigue; weight gain; cold intolerance
cautions: Regular medication adherence
medications: Levothyroxine
prevention: Iodine sufficiency; early detection
treatment: Lifelong thyroid hormone replacement

overview: Recurrent sinus pain due to chronic inflammation.
symptoms: Facial pressure; nasal congestion
cautions: Rule out migraine or infection
medications: Nasal steroids; decongestants
prevention: Allergy management
treatment: Treat infection and reduce inflammation

overview: Nausea from movement (travel-related).
symptoms: Dizziness; nausea; sweating
cautions: Avoid reading or screens while moving
medications: Dimenhydrinate; meclizine
prevention: Sit facing travel direction
treatment: Antihistamines or scopolamine patch

overview: Difficulty falling or staying asleep.
symptoms: Fatigue; poor concentration; irritability
cautions: Avoid caffeine and late screens
medications: Melatonin; sleep aids (short-term)
prevention: Good sleep hygiene
treatment: Cognitive-behavioral therapy for insomnia

overview: Breathing stops during sleep causing poor rest.
symptoms: Snoring; daytime sleepiness; choking at night
cautions: Untreated cases raise heart risk
medications: CPAP therapy; weight loss
prevention: Maintain healthy weight
treatment: Continuous positive airway pressure use

overview: Long-term fatigue not relieved by rest.
symptoms: Extreme tiredness; poor focus; body aches
cautions: Exclude thyroid or infection causes
medications: Antidepressants; graded exercise
prevention: Stress management
treatment: Symptom-based multidisciplinary care

overview: Functional gut disorder without structural disease.
symptoms: Abdominal cramps; bloating; irregular bowel habits
cautions: Identify and avoid trigger foods
medications: Antispasmodics; probiotics
prevention: Dietary fiber; low-FODMAP diet
treatment: Lifestyle and dietary modification

overview: Inflammation of stomach lining due to infection or NSAIDs.
symptoms: Upper abdominal pain; nausea; bloating
cautions: Avoid alcohol and NSAIDs
medications: Antacids; proton pump inhibitors
prevention: Avoid irritants
treatment: Treat cause and reduce acid

overview: Autoimmune reaction to gluten causing intestinal damage.
symptoms: Chronic diarrhea; weight loss; fatigue
cautions: Malabsorption risks if untreated
medications: Vitamin supplements
prevention: Strict gluten-free diet
treatment: Lifelong gluten avoidance

overview: Inability to digest lactose (milk sugar).
symptoms: Bloating; diarrhea; gas after dairy
cautions: Non-dangerous but uncomfortable
medications: Lactase tablets
prevention: Avoid or limit dairy
treatment: Dietary modification

overview: Severe overheating leading to organ failure.
symptoms: High body temp; confusion; no sweating
cautions: Medical emergency
medications: Cooling measures; IV fluids
prevention: Stay hydrated; avoid heat exposure
treatment: Rapid cooling and emergency support

overview: Tissue freezing injury from extreme cold.
symptoms: Numbness; pale skin; blisters
cautions: Can cause tissue loss
medications: Rewarming; pain control
prevention: Proper cold-weather gear
treatment: Gradual rewarming; avoid refreezing

overview: Fluid loss causing electrolyte imbalance.
symptoms: Dry mouth; weakness; dizziness
cautions: Severe cases need IV fluids
medications: Oral rehydration salts
prevention: Adequate fluid intake
treatment: Rehydration therapy

overview: Excessive worry interfering with daily life.
symptoms: Restlessness; palpitations; irritability
cautions: Seek professional help if persistent
medications: SSRIs; anxiolytics
prevention: Relaxation; therapy
treatment: Cognitive-behavioral therapy; medication

overview: Mood disorder with persistent sadness and loss of interest.
symptoms: Low mood; fatigue; suicidal thoughts
cautions: Immediate help if suicidal
medications: Antidepressants; psychotherapy
prevention: Exercise; social support
treatment: Medication and therapy

overview: Sudden episodes of intense fear and physical symptoms.
symptoms: Chest pain; breathlessness; dizziness
cautions: May mimic heart attack; rule out cardiac cause
medications: SSRIs; benzodiazepines
prevention: Stress management
treatment: Therapy and medication

overview: Neurodevelopmental disorder causing inattention and impulsivity.
symptoms: Difficulty focusing; hyperactivity; impulsive actions
cautions: Affects academics and social life
medications: Stimulant medication; behavioral therapy
prevention: Structured routines
treatment: Medication and counseling

overview: Developmental condition affecting communication and behavior.
symptoms: Social difficulty; repetitive actions
cautions: Early intervention crucial
medications: No specific drugs
prevention: Prenatal care; early screening
treatment: Behavioral and occupational therapy

overview: Inner ear imbalance causing dizziness and nausea.
symptoms: Spinning sensation; vomiting
cautions: Avoid driving during attacks
